location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Central Asia, Persia, and Afghanistan. Bolshevik and Pan-Islamic Movements and connected Information.'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged into a number of sections, and a table of contents can be found on folio 1.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at f 326 and terminates at f 333, as it is part of a larger physical volume; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists primarily of summaries of letters, memoranda, and reports dated between 1 and 30 November 1919; the subject matter concerns Bolshevik and Pan-Islamic movements in Central Asia, Persia, and Afghanistan.The following titles are abbreviated in the file as indicated: Chief of the [Imperial] General Staff (CGS); Foreign Secretary (FS) — most likely — to the Government of India; and Viceroy of India (V).

name.namePart: Viceroy and Governor-General of India in Council
